fields.description:
When using the command of "Import Site" for an OnDemand instance, the importer showed an error page indicating an import is in progress rather than showing the progress.

Note, after the importer competed, the system was able to show the progress bar with 100%.

Please see the attached screenshot for the details.
fields.summary: Import could not show the progress correctly

fields.description:
Hello, 

I downloaded Confluence 5.8.4 Linux installer, ran bash atlassian-confluence-5.8.4-x64.bin 

Initial log:
=====================================
Unpacking JRE ...
Starting Installer ...
Jun 07, 2015 1:25:28 PM java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences$2 run
INFO: Created system preferences directory in java.home.

This will install Confluence 5.8.4 on your computer.
OK [o, Enter], Cancel [c]
o

Choose the appropriate installation or upgrade option.
Please choose one of the following:
Express Install (uses default settings) [1], 
Custom Install (recommended for advanced users) [2, Enter], 
Upgrade an existing Confluence installation [3]
================================================

Then I typed 2, Enter

It says:

=================================
The following default options cannot be used. You will be asked to provide alternatives for these options.
* HTTP Port (In use)


Configure which ports Confluence will use.
Confluence requires two TCP ports that are not being used by any other
applications on this machine. The HTTP port is where you will access
Confluence through your browser. The Control port is used to Startup and
Shutdown Confluence.
Use default ports (HTTP: 8090, Control: 8000) - Recommended [1], Set custom value for HTTP and Control ports [2, Enter]
======================================

If I type 1, then this happens again, which is normal. If I type 2, then this happens again, too! It tells me that default ports are in use. No prompt to let me type in my custom ports!

P.S. if I type 3, only the last line appears:
Use default ports (HTTP: 8090, Control: 8000) - Recommended [1], Set custom value for HTTP and Control ports [2, Enter]
Which mean it knows it only accepts 1 and 2.
fields.summary: Can't config custom port during install process

fields.description: h3. Summary Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Macro shows a text in PDF export instead of the actual table. h3. Steps to reproduce # Add _Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Macro_ on any page and configure it accordingly # Click {{...}} -> Export to PDF h3. Current Result The macro shows a text instead of the _Two Dimensional Filter Statistic_ table {noformat} T wo Dimensional Filter Statistics {noformat} h3. Expected Result The macro shows _Two Dimensional Filter Statistic_ table h3. Workaround No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Macro shows a text in PDF export

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on a link that redirects to a row in a table, the row isn't shown as the header of the table hides it

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# On Confluence, create a new page 
# Create a table
# Add an anchor to one of the rows of the table
# On the same page, create a link to the anchor
# Save the page and click on the link created on step above 

h3. Expected Results
The header of the table shoudn't hide the row that has the anchor

h3. Actual Results
The row with anchor isn't shown

h3. Workarounds
-
fields.summary: When an anchor points to a row in a table, the row is hidden by the table header

h3. Expected Results
Permissions are saved

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When comparing two different version of pages in Confluences, the 'blue', 'green' and 'red' colouring described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/confcloud/Page+History+and+Page+Comparison+Views] is no longer working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Edit it (make a change and save it)
# Compare the two versions

h3. Expected Results
The change is mark with blue, green or red, depending on the type of the change.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not coloured as it should. It has a strikethrough if it is removed though.

We can see this in the browser's JavaScript console:
{noformat}
Failed to run init function: TypeError: Cannot read property 'text' of undefined
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Coloring on page version comparison is incorrect

fields.description:

Issues:
* http://cl.ly/image/2F3I1k0Y1p3D

Summary

Making blocker so it doesn't ship

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Table of contents macro does not appear in the mobile versions of Confluence

h3. Environment
Confluence (tested with Atlassian Cloud 5.7-OD-48-071)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence using [Table of Contents Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Table+of+Contents+Macro]
# View page using mobile version (client has replicated using both iOS and Android)

h3. Expected Results
The table of contents should appear as it does on the full version.

!Screen Shot 2015-04-29 at 17.26.28.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The text appears but above it, the table of contents is missing:

!Screen Shot 2015-04-29 at 17.28.03.jpg|thumbnail!

h3.Solution / Workaround
Revert to server version instead by clicking the side-menu and select "Switch to Desktop Version"
fields.summary: Table of Contents Macro does not display on mobile version

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In confluence cloud, if a users personal space is deleted then there's no way to recreate it. 

h3. Environment
* confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete a users personal space
# Log on as the user
# Look for the link to create the personal space from the user menu, only a link to the space will exist
# Attempt to recreate the space using the direct url https://<instance-url>/wiki/spaces/createpersonalspace.action

h3. Expected Results
* The link to create the Personal Space is in the menu (rather than the link to the deleted space); or
* Clicking the link to the Personal Space displays the space (since the link exists)
* using the link to create the space allows the user to create a space. 

h3. Actual Results
* Clicking the link to the Personal Space results in an error {noformat}Page Not Found{noformat}
* Using the direct URL results in an error {noformat}The following error(s) occurred:
Your personal space already exists.{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to re-create a personal space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding/editing a ‘Space List’ macro in a page, we get the option to preview the page. When nothing is selected in ‘Scope of Spaces’, the preview show tabs.

Switching gives a ‘Page Not Found Error’.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a page in Confluence
# Add a ‘Space List’ macro (specially with results)
# Edit it
# In ‘Scopes of spaces’, make sure the ‘empty’ option is selected (if it was not, you need to change and refresh the preview)
# In the preview, there should be tabs, switch tabs (say ‘Favorite’ or ’New).

h3. Expected Results
The new tab is selected and the data in the new tab is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence goes to a ‘Page Not Found’ (sometimes on the same browser tab, other in another tab, but it always fails).
 
h3. Notes
This is only failing in the ‘preview’ of the macro when editing it. The tabs on the page work.

h3.Workaround
Don’t switch tabs, save the page (or a copy) and use the page as a preview.
fields.summary: Switching tabs in preview of Space List macro is giving ‘Page Not Found’ error

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a Space and set the documentation theme on it;
# Create a page with the table contents and some headers so it work.

*Expected*
Clicking on an item at the table should take the user to this heading.

*Actual*
Despite clicking on the table of content item, the user is not redirected at all.

*Workaround*
Change the Theme applied to the Space
fields.summary: The Table of contents does not work with the Documentation Theme.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Category Filter in the Spaces List macro has stopped working in the latest version of Confluence Cloud. It was working in Confluence Cloud 5.9.1-OD-2015.45.2-0001

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Version 5.9.1-OD-2015.47.1-0002

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure you have spaces which are categorised
# Add the 'Spaces List' macro to a page with the *Scope of spaces* set to 'category'.
# Save the page and then try to sort by the category

h3. Expected Results
* The list of spaces in the macro will refresh to reflect the filter - the list will match that in the space directory when a category is selected, for example:
 !Screen Shot 2015-11-17 at 4.45.54 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The list of spaces in the macro does not refresh or change, the wrong spaces are displayed
 !Screen Shot 2015-11-17 at 4.46.23 pm.png|thumbnail! 
No errors are showing in the logs or the console. 

h3.Workaround
Use the Space Directory to view spaces by category instead.
fields.summary: The Category Filter in the Spaces List macro has stopped working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When multiple JIRA Issues Macros are on one page if you go through and edit them to customise which columns are displaying then the changes won't save for all macros, they appear to only save for the first.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Create a JIRA issues macro that returns multiple issues
# Copy that macro and paste it 3 times below
# Go through each of the macros and customise by removing a different column from each.

h3. Expected Results

Each macro will have a different column not displaying

h3. Actual Results

The macros will all show the same columns, typically the same as the first. If you edit the page again and change only macros 2, 3 and 4 then macros 2, 3 and 4 will show the same columns and 1 will be different.

h3.Workaround

After editing each macro save the page. Don't try and save multiple macro edits at once.
fields.summary: Customising multiple JIRA Issues Macros in one edit not saving correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The refresh button in the application navigator doesn't work for Confluence - the spinner keeps spinning forever, the links are never updated. 

h3. Environment
* Atlassian Cloud 
* Confluence 1000.139.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the hamburger menu at the top left hand corner of the screen in Confluence
# Click on the *Configure...* button
# Click on the Refresh symbol above the list of application links (to the top right of the list)

h3. Expected Results
# The application links are refreshed and the refresh symbol stops spinning

h3. Actual Results
The refresh symbol continues to spin forever

The below exception can be seen in the console
{noformat}
POST https://mpaisley.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/capabilities-consumer/1.0/admin/refreshcache 403
(Forbidden){noformat}
fields.summary: The refresh button in the application navigator doesn't work for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are unable to import Word Documents to be used as Confluence Pages in their instance

h3. Environment
* 5.9.0-OD-59-126

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence or go to an existing page (you want to view the page, not edit it).
# Choose !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/704577869/ellipsis.png?version=1&modificationDate=1422393340385&api=v2!  > *Import Word Document*
# Choose *Browse* and locate the Word document you want to import then choose *Next*.
The import document options appear.  
# Enter a *title* for the new page
# Choose *where* you want to import the file - used _Import as a new page in the current space_
# Choose how to handle *title conflicts* - used _Rename imported pages if page name already exists_
# Choose whether to create a single page or multiple pages based on the heading styles in the file (this option is only available if the file contains heading styles). - _N/A as example document did not contain heading styles_
# Click *Import*.

- Other import options also generate the NPE when attempting the Word Doc Import
- Both Word 91-2004 (.doc) and Word Document (.docx) file types generate the NPE

h3. Expected Results
Page is imported successfully

h3. Actual Results
NPE is generated and displayed on page:
{noformat}
Cause
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
caused by: java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: pageManager
    at com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction.resolveTitleConflicts(WordImportAction.java:637)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
It appears if the Word Document is attached and the Office Word Macro is utilized, the document can be displayed

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Unable to Import Word Document to Confluence

With 5.8 the head row of large tables is supposed to stick when scrolling down. The automatic row numbering is working, so I know that the table update is in effect.

I am not able to get my header row to stick in Confluence cloud.

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create a new page.
# Give page a title.
# In the body of the page, insert a three column, 25 row table.
# Add information in the header of each column (used just A B C).
# Click *Save*.
Note: No other editing is done. The page is using the default theme. There are no page layout sections. There are no tables within the table. There is only one header row, and not a header column.

!Edit Table.png|thumbnail!

*Expected Result*:
As I scroll the page down, the header row should remain visible.

*Actual Result*:
Header row scrolls off the viewable page.
!attachment-name.jpg|thumbnail!

!Scroll Table.png|thumbnail!

I'm happy to supply a link to the page since it is in cloud and so you can see yourself.

fields.description:
When using an Attachment macro and restricting this macro with a label on it to show only the attachments with the associated label, Confluence fails to update the label on the attachment being inserted.

*notes*: This behaviour only happens if the user attempts to drag&drop the attachment.
In case the "browse for files" button is used, the attachment is updated with the correlated label.

h3. Steps to repro
* Create an attachment macro;
* Put a label on this macro;
* Drag and drop an attachment on this macro

h3. Expected behaviour
The attachment will be listed in the macro along with any other attachment.
Which means that the macro label will be applied on the attachment

h3. Actual behaviour
The attachment is uploaded just fine to the page, but does not display on the macro because it lacks the required label.
fields.summary: drag&dropping file to a label-filtered Attachments macro does not add the label to file

h3. Summary
If auto numbering is enabled by selecting *Table Settings >> Insert numbering column* on a Table as described in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/confcloud/Tables

Selecting the Cut option and pasting the row into the same table shifts all columns and adds in new blank column to all other rows, and an empty column on the inserted row.

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.39.1-0001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert table on a page
# Select Table Options cog drop down
# select *Insert numbering column*
# Use Cut Row Option
# Use Paste Row option to new row in table

h3. Expected Results
Row pasted in matching format of table

h3. Actual Results
- New column is added to all existing rows with no data in field
- Newly entered Row has one less column and data is shifted

h3.Workaround
The copy row will paste in correct format so Use Copy Row and paste to new row then delete source row

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If images were uploaded to a page, the email notification sent to watchers does not show these images properly (appearing as image icons) when changes are made related to such images. Images are displayed correctly in the email if the images were attached using the *Images from the web* feature.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.110.0 and 1000.144.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page that has images that were uploaded from a local computer.
# Make changes to these images or attach new images using the upload feature.

h3. Expected Results
A notification email is sent and the images are displayed properly in it.

h3. Actual Results
Images uploaded to a page are not displayed in the email notification if they were uploaded from the computer.
!Screen Shot 2016-07-05 at 12.19.33.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Images are displayed properly in the _Recommended in Confluence_ emails.

h3.Workaround
If possible, use the *Images from the web* feature to attach images to a page. Otherwise, no other workaround is available.
fields.summary: Email notifications does not display images properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever a border is applied to an original sized image, the image no longer scales when the browser is resized.

h3. Environment
 
* Confluence Cloud v. 1000.245.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Attach a large image to a page in Confluence
# Select 'Original' for size
# Click on 'Border' to apply a border
# Publish page
# View page and resize browser window

h3. Expected Results

Image scales in size whenever browser window is resized

h3. Actual Results

Image size remains static whenever browser window is resized


h3.Workaround

When attaching the image, apply the border first, THEN click 'Original'. Performing actions in this order allows the image to scale when browser window is resized.
fields.summary: Border Causes Images to Not Scale When Browser Resizes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Page with title which contain special character will have page ID in the url instead of having the page name as mentioned in this suggestion ticket [CONF-11285|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11285]. This break the task's location link in task report macro, the task's location url will lead you to *Page Not Found* error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with title which contain special character like "%" , "+" , "&" etc.
# You will have the URL similar to this :
https://stan.jira-dev.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1441800
# Create a task in this page.
# Create another page under the same space, add in the *task report* macro to list out the tasks under the same space.
# Click on the task's location link under the *task appears on* column for the page with special character in the title.
# It will bring you to *Page Not Found* and the url will be like:
https://stan.jira-dev.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1441800?focusedTaskId=2

h3. Expected Results
The task's location link should bring you to the page which include the task.

h3. Actual Results
It show *Page Not Found* instead.

h3.Solution / Workaround
Edit the page name and eliminate the special characters from the title so that you will have the page url in the general format like :
https://stan.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/PM/Notification+test
<instance URL>/wiki/display/<Space ID>/<Page Title>
fields.summary: Task's location in Task Report Macro shows page not found when the page title contains special character

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing the permissions page which has a group containing ' or ", the page freezes upon saving the changes.

Note: It occurs in Google Chrome and Firefox, but not in Safari.

h3. Environment
* Chrome version 45.0.2454.93
* Firefox version 40.0.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group containing the "/", example: JIRA'S or JIRA"S
# Browse to {{Confluence URL}}/spaces/spacepermissions.action?key='SPACEKEY'
# Edit any permission on the page and add the group.
# Click "Save All"
# Page freezes.

h3. Expected Results
# The page saves changes.

h3. Actual Results
# The page freezes.
fields.summary: Permissions page freezes after editing when a group listed on the page contains a ' or "

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the iframe since the may 10th update, no longer recognizes data past the first ampersand (& shown as %40) of a URL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# add iframe to confluence Page
# Set a multipart URL, Exe Google Calendar:
{code}
https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?title=TEST&src=test%40gmail.com&src=testcalendar%40resource.calendar.google.com&ctz=America/Chicago
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Tile (TEST), user Calendar (test) , & added calendar (TestCal1) will render in iframe as intended

h3. Actual Results
Nothing beyond First ampersand (&) is rendered and only the title is set:
!Screen Shot 2016-05-12 at 3.18.05 PM.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
Renders correctly for single calendar input:
{code}
https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=testcal1%40google.com&ctz=America/Chicago
{code}
!Screen Shot 2016-05-12 at 3.27.18 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
there is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Iframe macro fails to parse multi part paramaters in URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on a PDF file from the search bar, the PDF preview is launched but it keeps on loading forever and never actually displays the PDF file.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Seen on Confluence 1000.163.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a PDF file to a page
# Insert it on a page using the *Insert files and images* option.
# Search for your PDF file in the search bar and click on your PDF file when displayed in the results (see screenshot).
 !Screen Shot 2016-07-19 at 14.16.57.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
PDF file is previewed correctly.

h3. Actual Results
PDF file preview is loading but never displayed as an infinite spinning wheel is displayed instead.
 !Screen Shot 2016-07-19 at 14.18.00.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes
No errors are displayed in Confluence logs.

h3.Workaround
There is currently no known workarounds. However, previewing works normally when previewing the file from within the page where it is attached.
fields.summary: PDF preview is not loading when opening the file from the search bar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence sidebar collapses to 3 levels when there's {{startDepth=3}} condition in sidebar customisation if links after third level is clicked.

h3. Environment
* 6.0.0-OD-2016.08.1-0001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page.
# Navigate to *Space Tools > Look and Feel > Sidebar, header and footer*.
# Enter this condition at the sidebar customisation:
{noformat}
{pagetree:root=@none|searchBox=true|startDepth=3}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar to remember the last click and remain opened on and after level 4.

h3. Actual Results
Sidebar collapses back to 3 levels and doesn't remember the page that was clicked at and after level 4.
 
h3.Workaround
Remove the {{startDepth}} condition and the sidebar should appear correctly.
fields.summary: Confluence sidebar collapses to 3 levels when there's startDepth=3 condition in sidebar customisation if links after third level is clicked

fields.description:
h3. Summary When importing a Word document into Confluence that contains a table that originated from Confluence, Confluence fails to include an opening tag. It does however include the closing
tag. The table starts with tags instead. This causes formatting issues when viewing the imported page. {noformat}

Misc Information

{noformat} h3. Environment Cloud - 1000.226.2 h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new Confluence page # Add a table to the page # Save the page # Export the page to a Word document # Import the page back into Confluence h3. Expected Results Confluence should respect the table formatting in the original document h3. Actual Results Confluence renders the table incorrectly as there is no opening tag in the underlying HTML h3. Notes If the table was originally created in Word and then imported into Confluence, it appears to render correctly. h3.Workaround Currently there is no work around except for manually editing the table layout in the Confluence editor once the page has been created. Once the table has been corrected, Confluence will render the page correctly.
fields.summary: Table fails to render correctly when imported from Word doc that was created from Confluence space / page

fields.description:
Hi,

The problem occurs if we try to nest a macro within another macro. To be concrete, we try to nest the [Beautiful Math macro | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ch.mibex.confluence.beautifulmath] within the [Numbered Headings Macro | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/nl.avisi.confluence.plugins.numberedheadings].

If we don't nest, we can display both macros on a page without any issues. But if we need the page numbered we have to include the numbered headings macro and for formulas we need the Beautiful Math Macro too. In this situation we get a macroId for the Beautiful Math but when requesting the macro details by /rest/api/content/ID/histroy/ID/macro/id/ID on request we get 404 response code.

To make it more clear, we used cURL to compare the two cases (nested macro and not nested) and got different results (only in the not nested case we were able to retrieve the macro content). Curl statements and their results are listed in the attachment.

Thanks for any help!

Best regards,
Michael from Mibex Software
fields.summary: Getting 404 when accessing macro content via REST when macro is nested

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

The *Open* link in notification messages for *JIRA updates* on the workbox notification in Confluence is pointing to the old JIRA Server url ([http://jira.intra.aktsk.jp/]) when it should point to his JIRA Cloud instance URL ([https://akatsuki.atlassian.net|https://akatsuki.atlassian.net/]). 
Notifications for Confluence update is working fine.
h3. Action Done
 # Created a test project and test issue in JIRA to verify the problem.
 # Commented on the JIRA issue : [https://akatsuki.atlassian.net/browse/ATP-1]
 # I received the notification in Confluence notification box but when I clicked at the *Open* link at the workbox notifcation, it will bring you to the old JIRA URL which give you the error server not found.
 # Commented on the issue from the notification box in Confluence, then received an error message stated "Application Link does not exist. Please contact administrator"
 # Restarted the instance as stated in this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Links+in+Confluence+Workbox+Show+Wrong+URL]
 # Removed the plugin cache.
{noformat}
rm -rf /data/jirastudio/confluence/home/bundled-plugins
rm -rf /data/jirastudio/confluence/home/plugins-cache
rm -rf /data/jirastudio/confluence/home/plugins-osgi-cache
rm -rf /data/jirastudio/confluence/home/plugins-temp{noformat}

 # Does not solve the problem.
 # Manually updated the database.
{noformat}
update "AO_9412A1_AOREGISTRATION" set "DATA" = replace("DATA", '"displayURL":"http://jira.intra.aktsk.jp"', '"displayURL":"https://akatsuki.atlassian.net/"') where "ID" like 'com.atlassian.mywork.providers.jira:d033391c-4eaa-328e-9610-8d4695e6e7db';
{noformat}

 # Does not seem to solve the problem as well.
fields.summary: Links to JIRA Server in Confluence notifications is unchanged after the JIRA Server Base URL was changed

fields.description:
This happens when I want to start a new line of text in my Confluence article as a heading. My steps are as follows:
* Start a new Confluence article
* Start a new line
* Go to the text style selection dropdown (the one that says "Paragraph | Heading 1 | Heading 2, etc")
* Select Heading 1 (or 2 or whatever)
* Start typing my heading

Expected behavior:
The text I type will show up on my line as heading text

Actual behavior:
Nothing happens. (the text editor loses focus -  have to click on the editor again to start typing)

Workaround:
* Click back in my text. 
* In the midst of whitespace, locate the (empty) line where I wanted the header
* Notice that the blinking cursor is the right height for a header
* Start typing
As you can see, my workaround is not ideal.
fields.summary: Editor loses focus when changing formatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a space has no name set (will appear as _$space.name_ in *Space Permissions*), then clicking on the *Create* button in Confluence will lead to the creation pop up page loading forever.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.223.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# You will need to have a space that appears as _$space.name_ in Confluence *Space permissions*
# Click on *Create* in the top navigation bar.

h3. Expected Results
Blueprints are loaded correctly and you are able to create a page or space.

h3. Actual Results
Pop up page listing all the blueprints available loads forever.
 
h3.Workaround
Set a name for the space that appears as _$space.name_ and the issue will be resolved.
fields.summary: Cannot create a page or space if a space has no name set

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a page is in edit mode and you drag a file from your computer and drop it directly into the page's body, the file is never uploaded and the upload modal says it's uploading the same files 2 times, however the upload status is just "_Waiting_".
h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud version 1000.139.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Confluence page and edit it
# Open your computer's file explorer (Finder, Windows Explorer, Nautilus, etc)
# Drag one file from it and drop it within Confluence's page editor

h3. Expected Results
The file is uploaded to the page
h3. Actual Results
This one file appears twice in the "_Attach files_" modal and the status "_Waiting_" never changes and the file is never uploaded.
!Screen Shot 2016-06-29 at 15.53.56.png|thumbnail!
The following appears in the browser's console:
!Screen Shot 2016-06-29 at 15.57.09.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Attach the file from outside the editor click the Options button (3 dots) > Attachments.
fields.summary: Unable to attach file to a Confluence page in edit mode

fields.description:
The scenario is which our plugin is operating is the following:

1) the plugin editor creates an attachment to the confluence page
2) without refreshing, the user "edit" the page
2) in the page editor, the user calls the custom macro editor
3) when the "Insert" button is pressed, the custom callback is invoked +only on second attempt+
4) when we save the page the macro is not saved properly
fields.summary: macro editor "insert" button callback functions only after second attempt

fields.description:
*Summary*
Confluence Administrator should not have the ability to configure attachment storage.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Login to Confluence Cloud as Confluence Administrator
# Navigate to Cog icon -> General Configuration
# Click on *Edit* button at *Attachment Settings*
# Set the *Attachment Maximum Size* 

*Expected behaviour:*
- Based on [Confluence Cloud Restriction function|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Restricted+functions+in+Confluence+Cloud], The above steps should not be able to perform.
- Allowing Confluence Administrator to set maximum attachment size could cause performance issue and out of memory error due to indexing bugs.
fields.summary: Confluence Administrator should not have the ability to configure attachment storage

h3. Summary

When nesting a Contributors macro within a Page Properties the Page Properties report macro will not populate the macro content.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start with a Confluence Cloud instance.
# In Confluence, create a page with a Page Properties Report macro on it.
# Create another page with the Page Properties macro in it that'll show in the Page Properties Report macro above.
# Insert a table into the Page Properties macro that contains the Contributors Macro
# View the original page with the Page Properties Report on it.

h3. Expected Results

The page properties for the space will populate in the page properties report. 

h3. Actual Results

On the contributors macro it doesn't render and returns an odd result: {"contextEntityId":12222521} although in preview "mode" it works expected.
fields.summary: Page properties report broken when Contributors macro

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start up a Cloud instance with the timezone set to Sydney time (GMT+11)
# Set your profile's time zone within Confluence to be Hawaii (GMT-10)
# Create a task on a page, assigned to yourself, and with a due date of the current date as of Hawaii time
# Complete the task and look at the "Completed on" date in Profile > Tasks.

h3. Expected result
The "Completed on" date is today as of Hawaii time

h3. Actual result
The "Completed on" date is listed as what would be tomorrow in Hawaii time (today in Sydney time, i.e. server time).
fields.summary: "Completed on" date for tasks in Profile > Tasks displays in server timezone, not user's own timezone

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the JIRA macro in Confluence, is not possible to get the Epic name displayed on it. It is possible to select it "Epic name" as one of the columns, but it will have no content. If we add another column related to the epic, like "Epic Link" for example, it does show this data.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an epic in JIRA
 # Create a document in Confluence and add the JIRA macro
 # After searching for the epic, add *Epic name* as one of the columns you want to display
 !JIRA macro.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The name,status, color of the epic would be displayed in the Epic name column
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is displayed 
!image-2018-06-20-23-49-22-894.png|width=348,height=53!  
[^Epic name.png]
h3. Workaround

There's no workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: "Epic name" column in JIRA macro for Confluence displays nothing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Per [Attachments Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Attachments+Macro] documentation, the Drag and Drop area should be labeled "Drag and drop to upload or *browse* for files". Currently, this is not labeled, and is just whitespace. Drag and drops till works.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Attachments Plugin : 3.6.17
* Confluence 5.9.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Page
# *Add Attachments Macro*

h3. Expected Results
Should be able to view drag and drop hot zone as in the Attachments Macro article, linked above

h3. Actual Results
Label is gone and you will just see blank space:
!Screen Shot 2015-07-13 at 13.46.05.jpg|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
- Drag and drop still works if you drag to the dotted section
- Customers report being able to see the section in Internet Explorer, but not Chrome.
fields.summary: Attachment macro no longer labels section to Drag and Drop to add files

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing a word document (.docx) with screenshots included, the page will not include the images, or will include broken links instead of the images. This also happens when you copy and paste all of the content from the document into a page editor.

h3. Environment
Tested on both Chrome and Firefox with same results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy and paste images into a word document, save document
# Attempt to either import the word document or copy and paste the content from the document into the page editor. The images will not appear, and a stack trace is thrown in the logs.

h3. Expected Results
All content including images should appear in the page.

h3. Actual Results
They don't, and the below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Searching for Groups does not always return accurate results.  

For example, when searching for groups with multiple words, only searching for the first word in the Group name will return the group.  

This is the case when searching for a group to add to page permissions, or space permissions. 

!Screen Shot 2016-04-05 at 2.19.32 pm.png|thumbnail! 
!Screen Shot 2016-04-05 at 2.20.36 pm.png|thumbnail! 
!Screen Shot 2016-04-05 at 2.20.47 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* (Untested in other versions)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure you have a group with a name that has two or more words, for example *Group Name One*
# Click on the padlock icon on a page in Confluence to open the page restrictions menu
# Select either *editing restricted* or *viewing and editing restricted* from the drop down
# Search for your group using a word in the group name that is not the first (for example Name, or One using my group name in step 1). 

h3. Expected Results
Groups containing the search word will show up.

h3. Actual Results
Only groups beginning with the search word will show up.


h3.Workaround
* Only use group names with one word; or
* Search using the first word in the group name.
fields.summary: Searching for Groups does not always return accurate results

h3. Summary
In Confluence Selecting the *Download all* option on a page containing a large amount of or just very large attachments, can lead to a page timeout and fail to proceede, and if launched multiple times will lock CPU and crash the system with {{Timeout waiting for idle object}} error that will not escape on system restart.  

h3.UPDATE:
- This does not seem to be limited to Downloading attachments we have now seen this occur on:
-- Download all attachments
-- page and Space PDF Export
-- Page XML Export
-- Viewing large pages
-- Viewing page with Content By Label Macro returning large result set

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence Administration >> General Configuration >> EDIT *Attachment Settings*
## Set *Attachment Maximum Size* to a large value (EXE: 99999999999999).
# Add multiple Gigs of attachments to a single page in confluence
## Successful test scenario was Five 2+ GB .zip files
# go to page attachments
## the ... dropdown upper Right >> Attachments
# Select *Download All*
# Page will time out
# Go Back 1 page
# Select *Download All* a second time

h3. Expected Results
Page should not time out on the first Select *Download All* operation, and attachments queued for download or error noting that attachments are too large

h3. Summary
*Link to JIRA Epic* placeholder is missing when creating JIRA issues from Confluence using the *Product Requirements Blueprint* as per the documentation here:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/use-jira-applications-and-confluence-together-427623543.html

h3. Environment
* Confluence version {{6.0.0-OD-2016.06.1-0009}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page using *Product Requirements Blueprint*
# Insert the link to any Epic in JIRA.
# Save the page.
# Highlight any text on the page and the _create JIRA issue icon_ will appear. Click it.

h3. Expected Results
The placeholder with a tickbox to link the issue being created to the Epic that is linked on the page will be visible.

h3. Actual Results
The placeholder is missing as per the screenshot: [^epiclink.png]
 !epiclink.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Link the issues that are created manually in JIRA.
fields.summary: "Link to JIRA Epic" placeholder is missing when creating JIRA issues from Confluence

fields.description:
*This is the Cloud version of CONF-34533. CONF-34533 was resolved as "Won't fix" because users can add the [HTML Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html] as a workaround to fix it. The HTML Macro is permanently disabled in Cloud instances and thus the workaround is not available. The issue is apparent in Confluence 6.0 and 1000.2.0*

When playing an embedded youtube video, inserted into a Confluence page using the Widget Connector, using Chrome it does not have the fullscreen button. I have tested this in the reported 5.4.3 and verified it still behaves this way in 5.5.4

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Embed a Youtube video into a Confluence page using the Widget Connector
# In Chrome, navigate to the page and play the video
# There will be no fullscreen button in the bottom right corner

h3. Expected behavior
There should be a fullscreen button in the bottom right corner.

h3. Actual behavior
There is no fullscreen button in the bottom right corner of the video.

h3. Related Notes
* The fullscreen button does appear using Safari and Firefox.

h3. Workaround
*The following workaround is for Server customers ONLY and cannot be applied in Cloud*

The workaround is to not use the Widget Connector, but embed the YouTube video directly in the page using the (disabled by default) HTML Macro

# Enable the [HTML Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html]
# Go to a page you want to have a YouTube video embedded
# Add an empty HTML Macro to the page
# Go to the YouTube video you want to embed
# Click the Share button in the video
# Click the Embed Tab
# Copy the full HTML code provided
# Paste that into the HTML Macro in the Confluence page
# Save the Page
fields.summary: Embedded Youtube Fullscreen Button Missing in Chrome (Cloud Version)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Typing Korean text into a Confluence page that's using page layouts (i.e. sections) doesn't correctly enter Korean text, it appears as English instead. This only occurs on Microsoft Edge or Internet Explorer, the problem does not occur in Chrome.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your machine to be using a Korean keyboard.
# Create a page in Confluence
# Add a section to your page
# Type into that section

h3. Expected Results

Korean Characters will be output.
h3. Actual Results

English characters are output. 

h3.Workaround

Enter your content without page layouts and then apply them after you've finished adding the content. Alternatively, copy + paste the content from elsewhere.
fields.summary: Unable to enter Korean text into a Confluence Page with page layouts on IE or Microsoft Edge

fields.description:
When an Administrator tries to disable *"CAPTCHA on login"* on the "Security Configuration" section, the change is not stored when Save button is clicked. 
Sysadmin can edit the option but changes still won't work and CAPTCHA is still enabled and configured to 6 failed login attempts.

Option available at: {{/wiki/admin/viewsecurityconfig.action}}

*To replicate follow:*
 [Configuring Captcha for Failed Logins|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Captcha+for+Failed+Logins] (Confluence Server documentation)


The option should be hidden as it is no longer managed by Confluence
There is already no documentation for this option on the Cloud space.

*Notes:*
Tested in JIRA + Confluence Cloud instance
Same configuration option is shown in JIRA and also doesn't work. [JRA-43241|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43241]
fields.summary: CAPTCHA on login doesn't work in Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Issue/Filter macro does not return URL in custom URL field as hyperlink.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud Version: {{6.0.0-OD-2015.50.1-0003}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Custom field in JIRA and create a custom *URL field* 
# Associate it to the default issue screen of Project ABC 
# Go to Confluence and create a page in Confluence and save
# copy the link of the page
# Go back to JIRA and create a new issue under Project ABC
# Fill in the summary, issue type and paste the Confluence page URL into the URL field
# Click on Create (e.g: ABC-123)
# Copy the URL of the ABC-123 issue
# Create a new page in Confluence and insert *JIRA Issue/Filter* macro into the page
#  Paste the ABC-123 URL into the macro
# Click on *Display options*, choose Display as *Table* and add custom URL field to the *column to display* 
# Click on Preview/Save, URL will be displayed as plain text instead of hyperlink

h3. Expected Results
When preview or save the page, the URL address in custom URL field will be shown as hyperlink and clickable

h3. Actual Results
When preview or save the page, the URL in custom URL field will be displayed as plain text and is not clickable
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Summary JIRA Issue/Filter macro does not return URL in custom URL field as hyperlink

fields.description:
h3. Summary Task Report does not load after import in Cloud. If a Space import is done with a Space using the Task Report macro on it, the link between report and tasks is lost because the ID of the page related in the task report macro changes, but the Task Report is not updated. h3. Steps to Reproduce # In another Confluence Server or Confluence Cloud create tasks on a page and a task report in another. # Export the Space with the Task Report. # Upload it and import it on Cloud. # Go to the task report macro page. h3. Expected Results The tasks appear in the task report. h3. Actual Results The tasks do not appear in the task report. !taskreport.png|thumbnail! It might also display some null error message: !Screen Shot 2020-04-08 at 17.21.01.png|thumbnail! h3. Notes The task report macro references a different page ID: * Wrong ID {code}

12222498

{code} * Correct ID {code}

8716290

{code} h3.Workaround Manually updating the report macro in edit mode usually fix the Macro so it renders the correct page.
fields.summary: Task Report does not load after Space import in Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to Inline Comment on an Expand Macro nested within an Excerpt Include macro

h3. Environment
* 5.9.1-OD-2015.45 
 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page with an Expand Macro Embedded within an Excerpt Macro
# Create a 2nd page with uses the Excerpt Include macro to pull the content from 1st Page
# On the 2nd Page, attempt to Inline Comment on text within the Expand Macro nested in the Excerpt Include Macro

h3. Expected Results
Inline comment is added or converted to a Comment

h3. Actual Results
On-screen message indicates {{Could not save the comment}} 
Confluence logs show:
{noformat}
WARN [ajp-bio-127.0.0.101-8009-exec-9] [plugins.inlinecomments.service.InlineCommentServiceImpl] attemptInlineCommentCreateForPage The text selection is wrong
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The inline comment only appears to fail when there is an Expand Macro Nested within an Excerpt Include Macro.  Separated, the macros appear to work and Inline Comment or Convert to Comment correctly.

h3.Workaround
On the Excerpt Include Macro, enable the option for "Remove Surrounding Panel," this will then show a message of "We can't add an inline comment to this content. We'll add it as a page comment instead." and successfully add a comment to the page.
fields.summary: Unable to Inline Comment on Nested Expand Macro
